results.name: For odd numbers 2n-1, the maximum number produced by iterating the reduced Collatz function R defined as R(k) = (3k+1)/2^r, with r as large as possible.
comment: See A075677 for the function R applied to the odd numbers once. See A075680 for the number of iterations required to yield 1. Sequence A006884, with the number 2 removed, gives the odd numbers that produce new record maxima. The maxima of the current sequence are related to A006885: if m is a maximum of the usual Collatz iteration, then (m-1)/3 is the maximum for the reduced Collatz iteration.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: a(4) = 17 because 7 is the fourth odd number and 17 is the largest number in the iteration: R(7)=11, R(11)=17, R(17)=13, R(13)=5, R(5)=1.
mathematica: nextOddK[n_] := Module[{m=3n+1}, While[EvenQ[m], m=m/2]; m]; (* assumes odd n *) Table[m=n; maxK=n; If[n>1, While[m=nextOddK[m]; maxK=Max[m, maxK]; m!=1]]; maxK, {n, 1, 200, 2}]
